alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 9:29PM CDT until June 16 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a nearly stationary thunderstorm producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. A nearly stationary thunderstorm producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
